A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Too many nonsensical plot developments

I liked the funny banter between Rey and Kylo and the "light speed crash" scene is an amazing image. But overall\, there were too many strange nonsensical plot developments. 


Problems: 
1. Does not build on important mysteries from previous film

Who are Rey's parents? It is simply mentioned by Kylo Ren. Are we supposed to just take his word for it?

Who is Snoke? Where did he come from? We never find out and he is killed.

Who is Captain Phasma? Why is she different from the other Stormtroopers? Character is never developed then she dies.

Why is there so much focus on Luke's light sabre if it's irrelevant to Luke?

2. Slow nonsensical chase scene with the rebels

Why can the rebel ships just stay "out of range" of the Star destroyers?

Why can the star destroyers only fire the rebels from afar? Are they using lazers or slow moving missiles?

Why does the new commander keep her plans a secret? Why not do the suicidal jump to light speed with another ship?

At the start of the film\, the "bombers" look incredibly slow and easy to target. Why use them at all?

3. Completely irrelevant sub-plot with Finn and Rose

What was the point of getting codebreaker if he wasn't going to help them anyway?

Why do they set the slave animals free but not the slave children?

There's no romantic chemistry or romantic build up between Rose and Finn. Why does she suddenly fall in love with him?

I don't agree with the critics that there was some deeper effort to keep fans guessing. I think it is simply poor story telling\, poor character development and invented dilemmas.
